result.execSummary:
The defendant L C Davis Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threaten w/ Obscenity [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(b).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
**01-30-17/ Judge Cynthia Davis**
The court orderedthe total amount of restitution as to Vanessa W-R, is set at a total amount of $2,478.49 ($1,800.00 in addition to the  $678.49 previously ordered). Any remaining balance to be paid within the term of the defendant's probation. Any balance unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment.
**


Set at $500.00 to Jeffrey C. and $678.49 to Vanessa W.,  due by 12--05-16. Court ordered CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT to be applied and balance to be held pending restitution hearing on 12-13-16 per order of the court costs, fees, assessments, etc are not to be taken from balance until restitution hearing held.

Hearing 12-13-16 at 8:30am, Br.21

- No contact with firearms. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crimes of domestic violence.
- NO CONTACT with victim, Vanessa W.

- Batterers Intervention program, or a course in Anger Management.
- Mental Health Evaluation and comply with recommended treatment.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3 and 4: Provide DNA sample. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant L C Davis in court.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 14, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Stipulation as to Restitution, signed, received and filed. 
Proposed Order filed.
Restitution Refund Packet
Restitution Refund Packet

Defendant L C Davis in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 21.
State orally amends offense dates listed on the Information as follows: Count 1: 1/30/2015, Count 2: 12/30/14-04/01/2015, Count 3: 1/27/2015, Count 4: 2/20/2015- 02/22/2015

State complied with victim notification. 

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional Statements made by Vanessa W. and Renee S.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive with count 2 and 3.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive with count 1 and 3.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS, concurrent.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive with count 1 and 2.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS, concurrent.

AS TO COUNT 4:
Court sentenced defendant to 20 days, with credit for 20 days time served. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court orders court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges be paid during period of probation imposed on counts 1, 2, 3. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 25 days on each count, consecutive (counts 1, 2, and 3) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review 1-13-2017 1:30 pm.
-Complete 20 hours on each count (counts 1, 2 and 3) of community service.
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management.
-Mental health evaluation and comply with recommended treatment.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim, Vanessa W.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation for counts 1, 2, 3 and 4, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at $500.00 to Jeffrey C. and $678.49 to Vanessa W., due by 12-05-2016 or civil judgment. 

Restitution hearing to be held in Branch 21 on 12-13-2016 8:30 am.

Bail on deposit to be applied to restitution ordered on 10-06-2016 and balance to be held pending restitution hearing on 12-13-2016 per order of the court cost, fee, assessments, etc are not to be taken from balance until restitution hearing held.  

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Court grants transfer of probation to the State of Illinois.

Filed: 
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
- Letters to the court on behalf of defendant.

Probation Review Hearing in Branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for January 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court VACATES Jury Trial.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, AND 4
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 

Case adjourned to branch 21 for Sentencing.

BRANCH 24 FOR BRANCH 21
Defendant L C Davis in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution. Amended Information, received and filed. 

AMENDED INFORMATION READS:
Count 1: Criminal Damage to Property (Less than $2,500.00 Damage), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.01(1) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor. 
Count 2: Unlawful Use of a Telephone (Obscene Phone Call), Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.012(1)(b), 939.51(3)(b), and 973.055(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.
Count 3: Criminal Damage to Property (Less than $2,500.00 Damage), Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.01(1), 939.51(3)(a), and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor. 
Count 4: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), and 973.055(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
